resources.string: You may switch off phone\'s screen if you use the volume butons or the Android Wear device
To pass the slides you may:

Watch Presenter is released under the Apache 2.0 License.

For a full copy of the license please refer to https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

This application includes code copyrighted by Google, Inc.

Note: Watch Presenter is not an official Google product and is not supported by Google in any way.

Watch Presenter needs a Chrome extension install on your computer to control the slides.

If you haven't installed the extension yet, do it now.

Search the Chrome App store for 'WatchPresenter'.

More info on watchpresenter.zuluindia.com

Once the Chrome extension is installed, this icon will appear next to the address on Chrome.

Once you see that icon, simply start the presentation full screen as you would normally do.

You will then be able to control it by using your phone
In order to control the presentation with the phone, just click on the volume buttons on the side of the phone. Volume up for next slide and volume down for previous slide.

When controlling the presentation with your phone you can switch the phone's screen off. This way you will save battery and avoid distractions.


Be sure to switch off your computer's screensaver and power management options. Otherwise, the computer's screen might turn off while presenting.
